titleStmt.title: A warning for maides: or The false dissembling,, [sic] cogging, cunning, cozening young man, who long did try and use his skill, to wo a coy young maid to his will and when he had obtain'd her love, to her he very false did prove. To a dainty new tune, called, No, no, not I.
titleStmt.author: Crimsal, Richard.

titleStmt.title: A warning for maides: or The false dissembling,, [sic] cogging, cunning, cozening young man, who long did try and use his skill, to wo a coy young maid to his will and when he had obtain'd her love, to her he very false did prove. To a dainty new tune, called, No, no, not I.
titleStmt.author: Crimsal, Richard.

publicationStmt.publisher: For Iohn Wright the younger, dwelling at the upper end of the Old-Bayley.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "All in a May morning in the merry month of May ..."
In two parts, separated for mounting; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
